body:
HTML/CSS/Javascript questions aid in evaluating a candidate’s front-end development skills. Front-end developers create the basic design and layout of the website, including the images, content, buttons, links, and navigation. They also ensure that the flow of the website is smooth and error-free. The back-end developers then use this front-end structure to add business logic and connect databases and processes.

Candidates have to write HTML, CSS, and JavaScript according to a prompt to prove that they know how to structure, design, and add logic to web pages. Candidates can render their code in the browser by simply clicking a button.

Learn how to create and score an HTML/CSS/JavaScript question here: 

  1. Creating an HTML/CSS/JavaScript Question
  2. Scoring an HTML/CSS/JavaScript Question
